citations.narrative:
In the kitchen area there was a white food storage bin that contained monkey biscuits. Upon further inspection, one of the
biscuits had a fuzzy-like white substance on half a biscuit, which had direct contact with surrounding biscuits. The biscuits
are used when the facility has trouble finding food due to natural disasters. It is required that food for marine mammals
must be wholesome, palatable, and free of contamination. Corrected by end of the inspection.

The facility has an adult non-releasable Floridian manatee, Guacara, housed singly in the enclosure labeled 36K pool. In
another enclosure, labeled 15K there is a juvenile male, Bajari, that is releasable within a year and also housed singly.
The Center has been offered to long-term house another non-releasable Floridian manatee, named Cayo, presently at
Zoo Tampa. It is the attending veterinarian's professional opinion that "Guacara" and "Bajari" should have the
companionship of a compatible animal of the same or biologically related species, on a short-time basis Guacara-Bajari,
and upon Bajari’s release Guacara-Cayo. Manatees are semi-social animals and do better medically and psychologically
when they are housed in pairs or groups. Marine mammals, whenever know to be primarily social in the wild, must be
housed in their primary enclosure with at least one compatible animal of the same or biologically related species.
To be corrected by May 15, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MARIO MERCADO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.105(a) 
   
Feeding. 
In the kitchen area there was a white food storage bin that contained monkey biscuits.  Upon further inspection, one of the 
biscuits had a fuzzy-like white substance on half a biscuit, which had direct contact with surrounding biscuits.  The biscuits 
are used when the facility has trouble finding food due to natural disasters.  It is required that food for marine mammals 
must be wholesome, palatable, and free of contamination.  Corrected by end of the inspection. 
3.109 
   
Separation. 
The facility has an adult non-releasable  Floridian manatee, Guacara, housed singly in the enclosure labeled 36K pool.  In 
another enclosure, labeled 15K there is a juvenile male, Bajari, that is releasable within a year and also housed singly.  
The Center has been offered to long-term house another non-releasable Floridian manatee, named Cayo, presently at 
Zoo Tampa.  It is the attending veterinarian's professional opinion that "Guacara" and "Bajari" should have the 
companionship of a compatible animal of the same or biologically related species, on a short-time basis Guacara-Bajari, 
and upon Bajari’s release Guacara-Cayo. Manatees are semi-social animals and do better medically and psychologically 
when they are housed in pairs or groups. Marine mammals, whenever know to be primarily social in the wild, must be 
housed in their primary enclosure with at least one compatible animal of the same or biologically related species.

To be corrected by May 15, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MARIO MERCADO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
